name: jacaranda
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ C or U ] any of a genus (= group of related plants) of tropical American trees with attractive, usually purple flowers: The city is lush with enormous, blooming jacarandas. The sleepy square was shaded by bright purple jacaranda.jacaranda tree She was sitting in the shade of a jacaranda tree.
[ U ] the wood of the jacaranda tree, used for making furniture and other objects: The tables were inlaid with ebony, rosewood, and jacaranda. This bench comes in oak, walnut or jacaranda.
More examplesFewer examplesSummer is fast approaching and the jacarandas in the city parks are in bloom.Old jacaranda trees shade the houses and their well-kept lawns.The smell of the jacaranda and the bougainvillea came through his small windows.Purple jacaranda blossom fell onto the roads.With its ebony and jacaranda-lined rooms, the hotel was an Art Deco masterpiece.
